image.altText: Close up of Donald Trump talking in suit with red tie and trees in background

props.synopsis: The ceasefire offer and talks come as both Iran and Israel continue to launch missiles at each other. Follow live.

title.children: Trump makes ceasefire offer, Macron says, as US president leaves G7 early

image.altText: Man listening to reporters' question, Australian flag behind him

props.synopsis: The US president will leave the G7 summit after tonight's leader's dinner, according to the White House, before a planned meeting tomorrow with Anthony Albanese. Follow live.

title.children: Trump's early exit from G7 'completely understandable': Marles

image.altText: A woman standing in front of her car.

props.synopsis: The prosecution team's closing address to the jury enters a second day. Follow our live blog as it happens.

title.children: A dumped dehydrator, a reset phone in Erin Patterson closing address

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Prosecutor says mushroom foraging evidence was a 'very late change' to accused's story
Prosecution says 'lies' about phones constitute more incriminating conduct

image.altText: a balding man in police uniform

props.synopsis: Tasmania's police commissioner names the officer fatally shot on Monday while on duty as Constable Keith Anthony Smith, a 25-year veteran of the police service.

title.children: Tasmanian police officer shot dead named as 'respected' constable

image.altText: The hands of a person counting through piles of $100 US dollar notes

props.synopsis: Has America's descent into authoritarianism destroyed its reputation permanently?

title.children: Why global money is abandoning America

image.altText: Streams of light against a dark night sky

props.synopsis: Israel's multi-layered air defences are the envy of militaries around the world. Here's how the Iron Dome, David's Sling and Arrow systems work against drone and missile strikes.

title.children: The Iron Dome, David's Sling and Arrow: Israel's air defences visualised

image.altText: Police gathering at a crime scene in a suburban street, with police tape across the area.

props.synopsis: Police are hunting down two gunmen believed to be behind the shooting of three people at Auburn on Monday. The victims remain in hospital.

title.children: Underworld hits 'sloppy' as gunmen behind Sydney shooting at large

image.altText: Man in a yellow shirt holding up a phone showing a photo of an older Indian woman with her grandchild.

props.synopsis: Imtiaz Ali Syed still can't bring himself to tell his mother that his brother was on board the Air India flight which crashed while taking off from Ahmedabad.

title.children: 'Haven't lost hope': Family holding out for miracle after Air India crash

image.altText: Daniel flips through a notebook.

props.synopsis: An "overworked and under-resourced" state agency, the WA Public Trustee, is facing fresh allegations of overcharging a vulnerable woman to manage her assets while doing little to no work.

title.children: State charges woman with dementia $137k while managing assets at a loss

image.altText: Four people stand inside a big cave.

props.synopsis: Deep in the Blue Mountains, archaeologists uncover artefacts that reveal secrets of the nation's Ice Age past.

title.children: Hidden in a Blue Mountains cave are artefacts that change the story of a nation

image.altText: The exterior of a large hospital, including a sign pointing to Emergency.

props.synopsis: An explosive report alleging Queensland Health failed to refer a young patient to a special care team before he died by suicide was withheld from his distraught parents, prompting claims of a "cover-up".

title.children: Health service rejects findings on patient who died by suicide

image.altText: Christine and her daughter Mia hug each other outside the front of their home.

props.synopsis: The proportion of Australian teenagers vaccinated against the virus that causes cervical cancer is the lowest it has been in almost 10 years.

title.children: Poor vaccine uptake a 'reality check' as situation worsening in Australia

image.altText: Two women sit on an unfinished deck outside a converted shed. They are looking at the camera with neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Anastasia and Lexie Gunn say their two younger children were conceived using a different sperm donor to their eldest boy, even though they requested the same donor be used in all three cases.

title.children: Couple ask government for 'advocacy' amid dispute with IVF giant

image.altText: a man in a muddy jacket is held by armed police in tactical gear

props.synopsis: The man charged with killing one Minnesota politician and wounding another visited the homes of other Democrats on his alleged hit list, according to prosecutors.

title.children: Accused Minnesota assassin stalked homes of two other Democrats, prosecutors say

image.altText: A close up of a sunscreen bottle.

props.synopsis: Peak consumer group Choice has defended its sunscreen testing and publicly released all tests in the face of criticism about its methods.

title.children: Choice doubles down on its sunscreen testing in the face of fierce criticism

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: One of the doctors accused of playing a role in Matthew Perry's death is expected to change his plea to guilty, admitting he injected the actor with ketamine on several occasions in the weeks leading up to his death.

title.children: Doctor admits injecting Matthew Perry with ketamine in exchange for cash

image.altText: RBA building

props.synopsis: Australians could see petrol prices rise as high as $2.20 a litre, as analysts warn the spike in oil prices fuelled by the Israel-Iran conflict will flow "directly to the pump".

title.children: Warnings interest rate cuts could be delayed if oil price surge continues

image.altText: Two women hug

props.synopsis: Advocates say a critical undersupply of housing has forced people onto the streets. But as more councils disperse homeless camps, rough sleepers are left with nowhere to go.

title.children: Housing crisis forces retiree out onto the streets to help the homeless

image.altText: A person with an umbrella walks towards parliament house.

props.synopsis: A custom desk that the Department of Parliamentary Services spent $20,000 to make is back in the building after being mothballed, but the department is playing coy on who has it.

title.children: A notorious $20,000 desk in parliament's storage is out of retirement

image.altText: Andrew Hastie press conference

props.synopsis: After a former immigration detainee allegedly "critically injured" a man in Melbourne at the weekend, the shadow Home Affairs minister questions why the government is not using powers granted to it to re-detain the cohort.

title.children: Hastie warns government not to wait for NZYQ group to be deported, after alleged assault

image.altText: GettyImages-2220028939

props.synopsis: Blues enforcer Payne Haas says Queensland's tactic of avoiding kicking to Spencer Leniu is one that has left him unfazed ahead of Origin II.

title.children: 'Weak' Maroons tactic leaves Blues enforcer unconcerned ahead of Origin II

image.altText: Cameron Smith hugs Cameron Munster

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster hopes to mirror his legendary former club and Maroons captain Cameron Smith as he leads Queensland out for the first time this week.

title.children: Munster, Maroons hoping to summon the spirit of 'generational' Smith to square Origin ledger

image.altText: Tom Dearden holds the ball in both hands during State of Origin I.

props.synopsis: The squads have been named, and the players are in camp as this year's second State of Origin instalment nears. Here's what to know about Game II.

title.children: Ready for State of Origin Game II? Here's what to know ahead of kick-off

image.altText: nsw police officers examine bushland in werrington after the body of a woman was found

props.synopsis: A 47-year-old man has been charged with the murder of a 47-year-old woman whose body was discovered in bushland in Werrington on the weekend.

title.children: Man charged with murder after woman's body found in Sydney bushland

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris pose for a photograph together.

props.synopsis: McLaren principal Andrea Stella doesn't see the team drastically changing its approach going forward after Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri's crash in Canada.

title.children: McLaren offers 'full support to Lando' after crashing into Piastri

image.altText: A line up of weights on racks in a gym.

props.synopsis: Illegal steroid use is on the rise among female bodybuilders, a study finds, but a lack of "steroid literacy" is making them vulnerable to its harmful side effects.

title.children: More young women are bodybuilding — and risking it with steroids

image.altText: Woodside protest outside courts 2025-06-16 08:06:00

props.synopsis: Yet another legal challenge has been lodged against a contentious gas plant extension in WA's north, arguing the state's previous environment minister failed to properly consider the emissions produced by customers burning gas produced at the plant.

title.children: Fresh legal challenge launched against Woodside's North West Shelf extension

image.altText: Tasmania Police officers hugging 16.06

props.synopsis: Questions remain about why the alleged offender opened fire on the officer, and why the police specialist tactical group remained at the end of a driveway, sending the uniform officers in first.

title.children: Officer shot dead while serving home repossession warrant — what we know

image.altText: A person hauls nets and marine debris buried underneath the white sand at a beach in Arnhem Land

props.synopsis: It's rubbish season in northern Australia, when tonnes of plastic and discarded fishing nets wash ashore in the Gulf of Carpentaria. But the future of funding for clean-up patrols is unclear.

title.children: Gulf ghost net patrols fear tide turning in fight to save remote beaches

image.altText: Greyhounds race down a grass track at Richmond Race Club in Sydney with a large TV screen behind them.

props.synopsis: An animal welfare group says greyhound racing is riddled with systemic failures as the industry body investigates a case of seven dehydrated dogs.

title.children: Vet finds seven greyhounds from same kennel dehydrated before race

image.altText: A bearded man standing with blue sky behind him looks ominously back over his shoulder

props.synopsis: The Australian director of Dangerous Animals always loved Jaws, but felt like the animals were hard done by. In his new Gold Coast-set shark thriller, they're not the bad guys.

title.children: This Australian-made shark thriller is pointedly scary and quotably funny

image.altText: Shane Jacobson in a bright, summery shirt stands in front of the Mildura oranges mural.

props.synopsis: Data shows tourism to Victoria's north-west has dropped despite a $390,000 campaign locals say fails to capture "what Mildura is really about".

title.children: Heat on council over costly Tropical North Victoria campaign 'flop'

image.altText: A high school student poses with her mobile showing her social media applications.

props.synopsis: A bill will be introduced to state parliament today to increase the jail time for criminals who post about their offences on social media.

title.children: Criminals who 'post and boast' to face two extra years in jail in Victoria

image.altText: slug on a leaf

props.synopsis: Researchers say it's important to keep dogs away from slugs and snails, and stop them from eating them.

title.children: 'Tip of the iceberg': potentially fatal disease for dogs on the rise

image.altText: A politician with blonde hair, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The NT attorney-general has revealed a $300,000 racism review into the NT Police Force has been scrapped, with the funding redirected to Legal Aid.

title.children: NT police racism review scrapped, funding redirected
